description: Self-service resolution scripts for common IT issues — one attempt before escalation

resolution_paths.title: Outlook Not Syncing
steps: Close Outlook completely (check it's not still running in the system tray)
Reopen Outlook and wait 2 minutes for it to sync
If still not syncing, go to File > Account Settings > Account Settings
Double-click your email account and untick 'Use Cached Exchange Mode'
Click Next, then tick 'Use Cached Exchange Mode' again
Click Next and Finish, then restart Outlook
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — may need OST file rebuild or profile recreation (admin required)

resolution_paths.title: Outlook Cannot Send or Receive
steps: Check you're connected to the internet (try opening a website)
In Outlook, go to the Send/Receive tab and click 'Send/Receive All Folders'
Check your Outbox — if emails are stuck there, open each one and click Send again
If that doesn't work, close Outlook, wait 30 seconds, and reopen it
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — may be a mailbox issue, transport rule, or mailbox full

resolution_paths.title: Outlook Search Not Finding Emails
steps: In Outlook, go to File > Options > Search
Click 'Indexing Options'
Click 'Advanced', then click 'Rebuild'
This will take a while — leave Outlook open and give it 30 minutes to reindex
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — may need profile rebuild or Windows Search service restart (admin required)

resolution_paths.title: Outlook Calendar Not Showing Events
steps: Make sure you have the right calendar selected in the left panel
Click View > Change View > Calendar to reset the view
If it's a shared calendar, right-click on 'Other Calendars' and select 'Add Calendar' > 'From Address Book'
Search for the calendar owner and add it
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — calendar permissions may need to be granted by admin

resolution_paths.title: Teams Audio or Video Not Working
steps: Click your profile picture in Teams > Settings > Devices
Check the correct microphone and speakers are selected
Click 'Make a test call' to verify
If your camera isn't showing, check if there's a physical privacy shutter or switch on your laptop
Try leaving the meeting and rejoining
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — may need driver updates or device permissions (admin may be required)

resolution_paths.title: Cannot Join Teams Meeting
steps: Try clicking the meeting link again from your calendar invite
If the Teams app won't open, try joining from the browser instead — go to teams.microsoft.com
Clear your browser cache if joining from web (Ctrl+Shift+Delete)
Restart the Teams app (right-click the Teams icon in the system tray > Quit, then reopen)
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — may be a Teams service issue or meeting policy restriction

resolution_paths.title: Teams Chat Messages Not Sending
steps: Check your internet connection
Try sending a message to a different person to test
Restart Teams (right-click the Teams icon in the system tray > Quit, then reopen)
If on the web, try clearing your browser cache and refreshing
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — may be a Teams service disruption

resolution_paths.title: Cannot Access SharePoint Site
steps: Try opening the SharePoint link in a private/incognito browser window
Make sure you're signed in with your work account (not a personal Microsoft account)
Clear your browser cache and try again
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — site permissions need to be granted by admin

resolution_paths.title: OneDrive Not Syncing Files
steps: Click the OneDrive cloud icon in your system tray
Check if there are any sync errors shown — click on them for details
Try pausing sync for 2 minutes, then resuming (click the cloud icon > Help & Settings > Pause syncing)
If a specific file won't sync, check it's not open in another application
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — may need OneDrive reset or storage quota increase

resolution_paths.title: OneDrive Storage Full
steps: Click the OneDrive cloud icon in your system tray > Settings to see your storage usage
Open OneDrive in your browser (onedrive.com) and go to the Recycle Bin — empty it to free space
Review large files: sort by size and move any personal files to a USB or personal storage
Consider moving old project files to a SharePoint team site instead
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — admin may need to increase your OneDrive quota

resolution_paths.title: Password Reset / Can't Log In
steps: Go to https://aka.ms/sspr (Microsoft Self-Service Password Reset)
Enter your work email address
Follow the verification steps (you'll need your phone for MFA)
Set a new password that meets the requirements (at least 8 characters, mix of uppercase, lowercase, and numbers)
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — admin will need to manually reset the password or check account status

resolution_paths.title: MFA / Authenticator Not Working
steps: Make sure the time on your phone is set to automatic (this is the most common cause of MFA failures)
Try using the 'I can't use my Microsoft Authenticator app right now' link on the sign-in page for an alternative method
If you've changed phones, you'll need your IT admin to reset your MFA registration
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — admin needs to reset MFA registration in Entra ID

resolution_paths.title: Account Locked Out
steps: Wait 15 minutes — most lockout policies automatically unlock after this period
Try logging in again with the correct password after waiting
If you're not sure of your password, use https://aka.ms/sspr to reset it
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — admin will need to unlock the account in Entra ID and investigate the lockout source

resolution_paths.title: Office App Crashing or Freezing
steps: Save any work you can and close the application
Open the app in Safe Mode: press Windows key, type the app name followed by /safe (e.g., 'outlook /safe')
If it works in Safe Mode, the issue is likely a bad add-in
Go to File > Options > Add-ins > Manage COM Add-ins > Go, and disable all add-ins
Restart the app normally and re-enable add-ins one at a time to find the culprit
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — may need Office repair or reinstall (admin required)

resolution_paths.title: Office Shows Unlicensed / Activation Error
steps: Close all Office apps
Open any Office app and go to File > Account
Click 'Sign Out' under User Information
Sign back in with your work email address
If it still shows unlicensed, try clicking 'Update Options' > 'Update Now'
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — admin needs to check licence assignment in Microsoft 365 Admin Centre

resolution_paths.title: Laptop Running Slowly
steps: Restart your laptop (a proper restart, not just closing the lid)
Press Ctrl+Shift+Esc to open Task Manager
Click 'More Details' if needed, then sort by CPU or Memory to see what's using the most resources
Close any applications you're not actively using
If Chrome is using a lot of memory, try closing some browser tabs
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — may need disk cleanup, startup program management, or hardware assessment

resolution_paths.title: External Display Not Working
steps: Check the cable is firmly connected at both ends
Try pressing Windows key + P and selecting 'Extend' or 'Duplicate'
If using a dock, try connecting the monitor directly to the laptop instead
Try a different cable if you have one available
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — may need driver updates or dock firmware update (admin required)

resolution_paths.title: Cannot Print
steps: Make sure the printer is turned on and has paper
Check for any error lights or messages on the printer display
On your laptop, go to Settings > Printers & Scanners > select the printer > Open print queue
If there are stuck jobs, click Printer > Cancel All Documents
Try printing a test page from the printer's own menu
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — may need printer driver reinstall or network printer reconfiguration

resolution_paths.title: Wi-Fi Not Connecting
steps: Click the Wi-Fi icon in the bottom-right of your screen
Make sure Wi-Fi is turned on (not in Airplane Mode)
Click 'Forget' on your current network, then reconnect by selecting it and entering the password
If that doesn't work, restart your laptop
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — may be a network infrastructure issue or device driver problem

resolution_paths.title: VPN Not Connecting
steps: Make sure you're connected to the internet first (try opening a website)
Close the VPN client completely and reopen it
If it asks for credentials, make sure you're using your work email and current password
Try restarting your laptop and connecting again
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — VPN server or configuration issue that needs admin attention

resolution_paths.title: Internet Running Slowly
steps: Try running a speed test at fast.com
If you're on Wi-Fi, try moving closer to the router or access point
Close any applications that might be using bandwidth (video streaming, large downloads)
Try restarting your router if you're working from home (unplug for 30 seconds, then plug back in)
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — may be an ISP issue or network infrastructure problem

resolution_paths.title: No Internet Connection
steps: Check if other devices can connect to the internet
Try restarting your laptop
If on Wi-Fi, try forgetting and reconnecting to the network
If at home, restart your modem/router (unplug for 30 seconds, plug back in, wait 2 minutes)
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — if multiple users affected, this may be an outage

resolution_paths.title: Cannot Log Into Xero
steps: Try opening Xero in a private/incognito browser window
If using SSO, make sure you're clicking 'Log in with Google' or 'Log in with Microsoft' (whichever your org uses)
Clear your browser cache and cookies for xero.com
Try a different browser
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — Xero account or SSO configuration may need admin attention

resolution_paths.title: Xero Bank Feeds Not Working
steps: In Xero, go to Accounting > Bank Accounts
Click on the affected bank account
Check if there's a 'Reconnect' or 'Refresh' option for the bank feed
If prompted, log into your bank to re-authorise the connection
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — bank feed disconnections sometimes need Xero support or admin reconfiguration

resolution_paths.title: Cannot Log Into Careview
steps: Check you're using the correct Careview URL (bookmark it if you haven't)
Try clearing your browser cache and cookies
Try opening Careview in a different browser
If you've recently changed your password, make sure you're using the new one
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — Careview account or database access issue requiring admin

resolution_paths.title: Cannot Log Into enableHR
steps: Go to the enableHR login page and click 'Forgot Password' to reset
Check your email (including spam/junk) for the reset link
Try a different browser or clear your cache if the page isn't loading
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — enableHR account issue requiring admin

resolution_paths.title: Docking Station Not Working
steps: Unplug the laptop from the dock, wait 10 seconds, and plug it back in
Try connecting the laptop directly to the dock (remove any USB-C adapters in between)
Check that the dock's power cable is firmly connected
Restart the laptop while it's connected to the dock
resolution_paths.if_not_resolved: Escalate — dock firmware may need updating or the dock may be faulty
